column3: A great opportunity to explore a submarine which served in WW2 - we were lucky enough to visit on a day when a veteran submariner was on board to walk visitors through the vessel, explaining what life was actually like working and living on a submarine. Could have spent the whole day in there! You can get up-close to the workings of the vessel, touch the levers and dials etc - however, being able to speak with someone who actually served on board made my day. Highly recommended!

If you love history and submarines you need to take an audio tour in USS Pampanito. And even if you donâ€™t know anything about second world war and submarines, take the tour. Awesome experience. There was also a volunteer veteran telling stories and asking questions. Very friendly staff at the ticket counter.
